data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new sender identity.**

You may create up to 100 unique sender identities.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new sender identity for your account. Accepts sender identity details including name, email address, and optional reply-to address. You may create up to 100 unique sender identities per account. Returns the created sender identity object with a unique sender_id. The new sender identity will require verification before it can be used to send marketing emails.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity about what inputs are expected, what is returned, and important side effects (verification requirement). Added details about request parameters, response object, and verification requirement for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ListSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Description is vague about what data is returned and doesn't mention pagination support. Enhanced with details about response structure and pagination capabilities for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all sender identities that have been created for your account.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all sender identities created for your account. Returns an array of sender identity objects, each containing the sender_id, email address, name, verification status, and other identity details. Supports pagination parameters to control the number of results returned.
data.reasoning: Description is vague about what data is returned and doesn't mention pagination support. Enhanced with details about response structure and pagination capabilities for better AI agent interpretability.

Description is too brief and lacks specificity about required inputs and response contents. data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific sender identity.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the details of a specific sender identity by its sender_id. Requires the sender_id path parameter. Returns the complete sender identity object including email address, name, reply-to address, verification status, and creation timestamp. Use this to view the current configuration and status of a particular sender identity.
data.reasoning: Description is too brief and lacks specificity about required inputs and response contents. Added details about the sender_id parameter requirement and comprehensive response object details for improved AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'DeleteSender' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_side_effects. Description lacks important details about side effects and operational constraints. Added information about the sender_id requirement, permanence of deletion, impact on email sending, and warning about active campaigns for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete one of your sender identities.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a sender identity from your account by its sender_id. Requires the sender_id path parameter. Once deleted, the sender identity cannot be used to send marketing emails and cannot be recovered. Ensure no active campaigns are using this sender identity before deletion.
data.reasoning: Description lacks important details about side effects and operational constraints. Added information about the sender_id requirement, permanence of deletion, impact on email sending, and warning about active campaigns for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ResetSenderVerification' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description is too vague and lacks context about when to use this operation, what happens as a result, and the verification requirement. Added details about the sender_id parameter, use cases, response confirmation, and the impact on email sending capability for improved AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to resend a sender identity verification email.**
data.description_suggestion: Resends the verification email for a sender identity by its sender_id. Use this when the original verification email was not received or has expired. The sender identity will remain unverified until the verification link in the email is clicked. Returns a confirmation response indicating the verification email has been sent. The sender identity cannot be used to send marketing emails until verification is completed.
data.reasoning: Description is too vague and lacks context about when to use this operation, what happens as a result, and the verification requirement. Added details about the sender_id parameter, use cases, response confirmation, and the impact on email sending capability for improved AI agent interpretability.
